interview_questions.question: How do you write a comment in CSS? Provide an example.
interview_questions.answer: CSS comments are written using /* and */. Example: `/* This is a comment */`.
interview_questions.explanation: CSS ignores anything between /* and */. Comments can span multiple lines and are useful for documentation or temporarily disabling code.

interview_questions.question: Can CSS comments be nested? Why or why not?
interview_questions.answer: No, CSS comments cannot be nested. If you try to nest them, the first closing */ will end the comment, which can lead to syntax errors.
interview_questions.explanation: CSS parsing does not support nested comments. Using nested comments can break your stylesheet.

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of using comments in CSS?
interview_questions.answer: Comments are used to document your CSS, explain sections of code, or temporarily disable parts of the stylesheet without deleting them.
interview_questions.explanation: Comments improve code maintainability and collaboration by providing context and explanations.

interview_questions.question: Will comments in CSS be rendered or affect the web page appearance?
interview_questions.answer: No, comments are ignored by browsers and do not affect the rendering or appearance of the web page.
interview_questions.explanation: Comments only exist in the source code and are not displayed to users.

interview_questions.question: Can you use comments to disable a single property in a CSS rule? Give an example.
interview_questions.explanation: This is useful for testing and debugging styles without deleting code.

interview_questions.question: Is it possible to use HTML-style comments (`<!-- -->`) in CSS?
interview_questions.answer: No, HTML-style comments (`<!-- -->`) are not valid in CSS and will cause errors.

interview_questions.question: Where can CSS comments be placed in a stylesheet?
interview_questions.answer: CSS comments can be placed anywhere outside property names and valuesâ€”in selectors, between declarations, before or after rules, or between rules.
interview_questions.explanation: They are flexible and do not interfere with the stylesheet as long as they are not inside a property name or value.

interview_questions.question: What happens if you put a comment inside a CSS property value?
interview_questions.answer: Putting a comment inside a property value (e.g., `color: re/*comment*/d;`) will break the property and cause it to be ignored.
interview_questions.explanation: Comments can only appear between properties, not inside property names or values.

interview_questions.question: Can comments be used in inline styles in HTML?
interview_questions.answer: No, comments cannot be used inside the style attribute of HTML elements. The browser will not recognize them as valid.
interview_questions.explanation: Inline styles only accept property-value pairs; comments will cause errors or be ignored.

interview_questions.question: How can comments help during the development and debugging of CSS?
interview_questions.answer: Comments allow developers to leave notes, organize sections, and temporarily disable code by commenting out rules or properties.
interview_questions.explanation: They make complex stylesheets easier to understand and maintain, and assist in troubleshooting by isolating code.
